questions.question_text: Data can be added to a KV store collection in which of the following format(s)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Could someone please verify the accuracy of this answer

choices.A: The namespace is a combination of the user and the app.
choices.D: The namespace is a combination of the user, the app, the role, the sharing level, and the permissions.
choices.C: The namespace is a combination of the user, the app, the role, and the sharing level.
choices.B: The namespace is a combination of the user, the app, and the role.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's A according to the discussion below:
https://community.splunk.com/t5/Getting-Data-In/REST-API-with-namespace/m-p/9596

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements define a namespace?
For a KV store, a lookup stanza in the transforms.conf file must contain which of the following? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
ABC

external_type
collection
fields_list
In the GUI the fields_list has an * making it a required field. ABC is indeed correct.
The answer is A, C. fields_list exists, but is not a requirement.

Answer is ABC see the reference for transforms.conf stanza
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.1.2/Knowledge/ConfigureKVstorelookups

questions.question_text: Which of the following are characteristics of an add-on? (Select all that apply.)

choices.C: Can depend on add-ons for correct operation.
choices.B: Occupies a unique namespace within Splunk.
choices.D: Contains technology or components not intended for reuse by other apps.

discussion.content:
Answer is C. 
- (A) Add-ons don't have own navigation menu
- (B) Namespace is a combination of user and app. Add-on is an app, so there must be several namespaces
- (D) Add-on are created to provide new abilities to other apps

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements describe oneshot searches? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content:
Ans is BC
B. Can specify csv as an output format. C. Stream all results upon search completion. 
Specifies the output format of the results (XML, JSON, JSON_COLS, JSON_ROWS, CSV, ATOM, or RAW).
ref:- https://dev.splunk.com/enterprise/docs/devtools/java/sdk-java/howtousesdkjava/howtoworkjobjava/ 
For those searches that stream the results (oneshot and export), the search results are not retained on the server. If the stream is interrupted for any reason, the results are not recoverable without running the search again.

Selected Answer: BC
It's BC.
A - It's wrong because a oneshot search is a synchronous search as we get the results upon making the request without the need for complementary requests in order to get the results
D - It's wrong becaus according to the domumentation auto_cancel refers to inactivity not to timeout (timeout is set by the timeout parameter).

choices.C: Stream all results upon search completion.
choices.D: Can use auto_cancel to set a timeout limit.
choices.B: Can specify csv as an output format.
